neighborhoods.name: Centre Historique
neighborhoods.character: The historic heart of Annecy, featuring medieval architecture, narrow cobblestone streets, and the city's most important landmarks including the Palais de l'Isle and the castle.

location.description: Located in the center of Annecy, bounded by the Thiou Canal to the north and extending southward to include the main squares and historic streets.

history.overview: The oldest part of Annecy, developed around the Roman settlement and later the medieval city center. Home to the Palais de l'Isle since the 12th century and numerous historic buildings.
history.significance: Represents the historical and cultural heart of Annecy, showcasing medieval and Renaissance architecture.
notable_events: Construction of the Palais de l'Isle beginning in the 12th century
Development as the commercial and religious center

transit: Walking distance to all major sites
practical_info.safety: Very safe with regular foot traffic and police presence.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for Palais visits, afternoon for shopping and cafes.
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable with pedestrian areas and short distances.

attractions.name: Palais de l'Isle
attractions.description: A magnificent 12th-century palace built on an island in the Thiou Canal.
attractions.appeal: The iconic symbol of Annecy with stunning canal views.

attractions.name: Place de la Paix
attractions.description: The central square surrounded by elegant buildings and the main market.
attractions.appeal: Perfect for people-watching and enjoying the local atmosphere.

attractions.name: Maison des Quatre Têtes
attractions.description: A remarkable Renaissance house with four carved heads on its facade.
attractions.appeal: One of the finest examples of Renaissance architecture in Annecy.

activities.name: Historic Walking Tour
activities.description: Explore the medieval streets and historic buildings.

activities.name: Shopping in Historic Streets
activities.description: Browse boutiques and artisan shops in medieval buildings.

stay_here_if: You want to be in the heart of historic Annecy
insider_tips: Visit the Palais de l'Isle early morning for the best light and fewer crowds.
Explore the side streets for hidden architectural gems.

neighborhoods.name: Château d'Annecy
neighborhoods.character: The area surrounding the imposing medieval castle, featuring dramatic lake views and a mix of historic and residential buildings.

location.description: Located on the western edge of the historic center, overlooking Lac d'Annecy and the castle's massive towers.

history.overview: The castle was built in the 12th century and later expanded. The area has been the defensive heart of Annecy for centuries.
history.significance: Home to one of France's most impressive medieval fortresses with stunning lake views.
notable_events: Construction of the castle in the 12th century

practical_info.safety: Very safe with castle security and regular visitors.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for castle tours, evening for lake views.
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable with scenic lake paths.

attractions.name: Château d'Annecy
attractions.description: A 12th-century castle with impressive towers and the regional museum.
attractions.appeal: One of France's most impressive medieval fortresses with lake views.

attractions.name: Lake Promenade
attractions.description: Beautiful paths along the lake with castle views.
attractions.appeal: Perfect for leisurely walks and photography.

attractions.name: Musée-Château d'Annecy
attractions.description: Housed in the castle with exhibits on local history and culture.
attractions.appeal: A unique museum experience in historic surroundings.

activities.name: Castle Tour
activities.description: Explore the medieval fortress and its museum.

activities.name: Lake Photography
activities.description: Capture stunning views of the castle and lake.

stay_here_if: You want to be near the castle and lake
insider_tips: Visit the castle early to avoid crowds and see the lake in good light.
Walk along the lake at sunset for magical castle views.

neighborhoods.name: Quartier des Fins
neighborhoods.character: A vibrant area known for its university presence, student life, and mix of historic and modern buildings.

location.description: Located south of the historic center, centered around the University of Savoie and extending to residential areas.

history.overview: Originally a residential area, it became the center of academic life with the establishment of the modern university.
history.significance: Home to Annecy's main university campus and cultural institutions.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with student population and university security.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Weekdays for university atmosphere, weekends for quieter exploration.
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable with wide sidewalks and bike paths.

attractions.name: Parc des Sports
attractions.description: A modern sports facility with various athletic venues and green spaces.
attractions.appeal: Active atmosphere with sports and recreation opportunities.

attractions.name: Musée d'Art Moderne
attractions.description: Contemporary art exhibits in a modern building.

attractions.name: University Campus
attractions.description: Modern university facilities with green spaces.
attractions.appeal: Experience the academic atmosphere of Annecy.

activities.name: Sports Activities
activities.description: Enjoy various sports facilities and activities.

activities.name: Museum Visit
activities.description: Discover modern art in contemporary surroundings.

stay_here_if: You want to be near cultural institutions
insider_tips: Visit the sports complex during university breaks for fewer crowds.
Check university event calendars for cultural activities.

neighborhoods.name: Quartier de la Gare
neighborhoods.character: A practical area centered around the main train station, offering good transportation connections and some commercial amenities.

location.description: Located east of the historic center, centered around the Gare d'Annecy train station.

history.overview: Developed as a transportation hub with the arrival of the railway in the 19th century.
history.significance: Main transportation gateway to Annecy and the French Alps.

practical_info.safety: Generally safe with regular travelers and transport staff.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Daytime for transportation, avoid late night.
practical_info.walkability: Good walkability with wide sidewalks and clear paths.

attractions.name: Transportation Hub
attractions.description: Easy access to trains, buses, and other transport options.
attractions.appeal: Convenient for exploring the French Alps and beyond.

attractions.name: Commercial Services
attractions.description: Various shops and services for travelers.

activities.name: Alpine Excursions
activities.description: Easy access to explore the surrounding mountains.

stay_here_if: You're making day trips from Annecy
insider_tips: Book train tickets in advance for better prices.
Use the station as a starting point for Alpine exploration.

neighborhoods.name: Quartier de la Prairie
neighborhoods.character: A beautiful lakeside area known for its green spaces, lake views, and recreational opportunities.

location.description: Located along the western shore of Lac d'Annecy, featuring parks, beaches, and lakefront promenades.

history.overview: Originally a natural area, it was developed as a recreational zone to take advantage of the lake's beauty.
history.significance: Offers the best access to lake activities and natural beauty.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with families and recreational users.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Daytime for activities, sunset for views.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent walkability with scenic lake paths.

attractions.name: Parc de la Prairie
attractions.description: Beautiful green spaces with lake views and walking paths.
attractions.appeal: Perfect for relaxation and enjoying the lake scenery.

attractions.name: Plage des Marquisats
attractions.description: Popular swimming and sunbathing spot on the lake.
attractions.appeal: Great for water activities and summer relaxation.

attractions.name: Lake Promenades
attractions.description: Scenic paths along the lake with mountain views.
attractions.appeal: Ideal for walking, jogging, and photography.

activities.name: Water Sports
activities.description: Swimming, kayaking, and paddleboarding on the lake.

activities.name: Lakeside Walks
activities.description: Enjoy scenic walks along the lake.

stay_here_if: You want lake access and outdoor activities
You appreciate natural beauty and recreation
avoid_if: You want to be in the center of action
insider_tips: Visit early morning for the best lake views and fewer crowds.
Bring swimwear in summer for lake activities.
